item.description:
Due to recent seacoast contamination from sewage plant,  I am changing our Sunday walk to Tower Hill Dam Pond in Auburn.  I will reschedule Fort Foster for a later date.

Any questions......send me an email or give me a call (603-674-8672)

Pack up your pooch, some doggie treats, dress in layers and let's meet at Tower Hill Dam Pond.  The loop hike is about 3 easy miles around the pond with lots of good smells and sniffs.

Don't forget your pooper bags !!

Parking is limited as the trailhead is off a dirt road.  Game plan is to meet at trailhead at noon time and walk the loop.  Should take us about 2 to 2 1/2 hours give or take.....depending on how good the smells are !

There are a few places on the dirt road that look like trail heads.   As you drive along the dirt road,  you will start to go up a slight hill.  The trailehad we will be using is the 2nd spot along the road....there is a metal barrier across the trailhead.   Look for the Orange Subaru Forester.

 

 

Plunk is looking forward to a nice walk with her regular buddies as well as meeting some new ones.

If you have any questions, please email Judi and Plunk

Woof woof

And don't forget to dress in layers. It may be a tad chilly along the water.
item.how_to_find_us: Plunk will be the cute beagle screaming "Over Here.....over here.......over here !!! "
item.why: Postponing Fort Foster due to contamination. Going to Tower Hill instead !

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Tower Hill Dam Pond - Auburn
